data.title: William Lewis Obituary
data.meta_description: Obituary for William Harrison Lewis | Portland, OR & West Rupert, VT-William H. Lewis, 76, passed away on Monday, August 20, 2018 in Portland, OR at the Pease Hospital from the effects of a stroke which he suffered in...
data.meta_site_name: William Lewis Obituary | August 20, 2018 | Salem, NY
data.text:
Portland, OR & West Rupert, VT-William H. Lewis, 76, passed away on Monday, August 20, 2018 in Portland, OR at the Pease Hospital from the effects of a stroke which he suffered in 2010.

He was born in Cambridge, NY and raised in West Rupert, son of C.H. Lewis, Jr. and Helen Shattuck Lewis. He attended Salem Washington Academy K-10 and graduated from Tilton School in New Hampshire in 1959. Will was a graduate of the University of Vermont in 1963. He was president of his fraternity, Sigma Phi Epsilon, and the Interfraternity Council. He received a BA degree and was commissioned a 2nd lieutenant in the U.S. Army through the ROTC program.

He married Patricia Baldwin Absten in 1964, and shortly thereafter was deployed to Vietnam where he honorably served as a member of the Night Hawks 20th ASTA detachment.

He lost his first wife to cancer. He later married Mary Florence Trohn in 1987, who predeceased him by five months. Also predeceasing him by a week was their dog, Sophie.

Bill was in national sales for Riegel Paper Co. for a short time and then the Boise-Cascade Corporation. Following his retirement from Boise-Cascade he was a self-employed contractor in the paper business.

During his early years he enjoyed fishing trips to Canada with his family and later fishing trips to Alaska with co-workers.

He is survived by a brother, Donald Shattuck Lewis of west Rupert, a nephew, two nieces, three cousins, a neighbor and compassionate friend, Andres Frate.

A private service will be held at the Gerald B.H. Solomon Saratoga National Cemetery at a later date.
